text:
9. C There is no intersection of events when events are mutually exclusive. P(A|B) = P(A) x
P(B) is only true for independent events. Note that since A and B are mutually exclusive
(cannot both happen), P(A|B) and P(AB) must both be equal to zero.
10. B P(name 1 or name 2 or name 3 or name 4) = 1/800 + 1/800 + 1/800 + 1/800 = 4/800
= 0.005
